title: Five cases of measles confirmed in an outbreak at a Florida elementary school
description: Five people have been diagnosed with measles in an outbreak at an elementary School in Weston, Florida.

title: Conservative group launches a quiet effort to drive Black voters away from Biden
description: An experimental stealth campaign during South Carolina's Democratic primary highlights one way players in the GOP will be trying to exploit Biden's weaknesses.

title: Nikki Haley needs Black South Carolina voters, but she shouldn’t count on getting them
description: Former governor Nikki Haley is likable to some Black South Carolina voters, but ‘mixed feelings’ persist, leaving an ominous feeling ahead of Saturday’s GOP primary.

title: Ex-FBI informant charged over false claims that fueled Biden impeachment inquiry due in court
description: Alexander Smirnov, who is charged with lying to the FBI about Joe Biden, Hunter Biden and Burisma, is set to appear at a detention hearing in Las Vegas on Tuesday.

title: Body of Audrii Cunningham, missing 11-year-old Texas girl, found in river
description: The body of missing 11-year-old Audrii Cunningham was found in the Trinity River in Texas, officials announced Tuesday.

title: Steve Kornacki: Nikki Haley’s home-field disadvantage? Republican voters
description: The story of Nikki Haley’s presidential campaign so far is simple enough.

title: Chile to reopen inquiry over Pablo Neruda's 1973 death
description: A Chilean appeals court ordered the reopening of an investigation into the death of the leftist poet and Nobel laureate Pablo Neruda in 1973 soon after the military seized power in a coup.

title: Former University of Nebraska basketball player says she was groomed by a coach for sexual relationship
description: Former University of Nebraska basketball player Ashley Scoggin sued the school, saying officials should have protected her from being groomed by an assistant coach.

title: Men who faked Justin Bieber, Billie Eilish,  Post Malone signatures plead guilty in $1.35M bogus concert scam
description: Two men defrauded more than $1 million from a concert promoter by impersonating Justin Bieber, Billie Eilish and Post Malone on performance contracts, the U.S.

title: What to know before buying and cooking with chocolate
description: Experts explain the difference between dark, milk and white chocolate. Shop the best chocolate from Ghirardelli, Lindt, Raaka, Hershey’s, Tony's Chocolonely and more.

title: Latino members of Congress seek changes in translations of immigration documents
description: Latino members of Congress want U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services to waive an internal policy requiring their congressional offices provide certified translations of non-English documents filed on behalf of immigrant constituents.

title: Mother of 'Baby Skylar' who was found dead in Phoenix airport trash can 19 years ago is arrested
description: The mother of a newborn girl found dead in a garbage can at a Phoenix airport in 2005 has been arrested after investigators dug back into the cold case using genetic genealogy, police announced Tuesday.

title: United flight from San Francisco to Boston is diverted to Denver due to a wing issue
description: A United Airlines flight from San Francisco to Boston was diverted to Denver on Monday after experiencing an issue with one of its wings, the airline confirmed Tuesday.

title: RFK Jr. questions effectiveness of the MMR vaccine
description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. expressed skepticism about the effectiveness of the measles, mumps and rubella (MMR) vaccine when asked about how to best protect U.S. children from the measles.

title: Bankruptcy judge says Rudy Giuliani can appeal defamation judgment but has to find someone else to pay the legal bills
description: A bankruptcy judge has ruled that Rudy Giuliani, the once-respected former mayor of New York City, can appeal the $146 million verdict after he was found liable for defaming two Georgia elections workers — if he uses pre-approved donors to pay the legal expenses.

title: Call for National Guard to help with high school violence stirs controversy in Massachusetts
description: Four school committee members in Brockton are requesting for the Massachusetts National Guard to assist in monitoring high school students following an increase in violence on campus.

title: Video shows man stealing cash from Girl Scouts as they sell cookies at Texas Walmart
description: Fort Worth Police are asking for help identifying the person they say stole cash from Girl Scouts in front of a Walmart earlier this month.

title: 'I refuse to quit': Nikki Haley vows to stay in the presidential race after South Carolina
description: Nikki Haley made clear in an address on the GOP presidential primary that she's not going to drop out soon even as she significantly trails Donald Trump.

title: American Airlines raises bag fees by $10 for luggage checked at the airport
description: If you're checking a bag for an American Airlines flight, expect to pay more.

title: WIC faces a budget shortfall. For millions of women and children, more than nutrition is at stake.
description: WIC is facing a $1 billion budget shortfall, alarming advocates who say healthy food is only one piece of the vital assistance that the federal nutrition program provides.

title: Historic California palm trees come crashing down into ocean amid powerful winter storms
description: A severe storm that pummeled California has taken a toll on some of the state’s most iconic trees.

title: 8-year-old chess prodigy breaks record after defeating 37-year-old grandmaster
description: Ashwath Kaushik, an 8-year-old chess prodigy, has set a new record by besting a grandmaster nearly 30 years older than him on Sunday.

title: Biden administration to impose major sanctions to hold Russia accountable for Navalny's death
description: WASHINGTON — President Joe Biden has directed his administration to impose major sanctions to hold Russia accountable for the death last week of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny, the White House said Tuesday.

title: Republican Eric Hovde officially enters Wisconsin Senate race against Tammy Baldwin
description: Wisconsin Republican businessman Eric Hovde officially launched his Senate campaign, finally giving Republicans a challenger against Democrat Tammy Baldwin.

title: N.Y. man running 'Breaking Bad'-style drug lab inadvertently turns himself in by reporting a burglary
description: A New York man who ran a "Breaking Bad"-style drug lab inadvertently turned himself in when he called police to report a burglary, prosecutors said.

title: Kristen Stewart calls for more wide-ranging discussions about LGBTQ films
description: Kristen Stewart is ready for conversations about films featuring queer and female stories to no longer focus on just that aspect of their identity, she told journalists at the Berlin Film Festival.

title: Giant brawl breaks out during handshakes after college basketball game in San Antonio
description: A wild brawl erupted Monday night in San Antonio after a college basketball game between host University of the Incarnate Word and Texas A&M University–Commerce.

title: RFK Jr. is courting Black voters, a group he once targeted with vaccine disinformation
description: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is courting Black voters for his 2024 campaign, a group he once targeted with vaccine disinformation.

title: Travis and Jason Kelce release video addressing ‘deeply tragic’ Kansas City parade shooting
description: Travis and Jason Kelce addressed the shooting at the Super Bowl victory parade in Kansas City during a video message on Instagram ahead of their newest “New Heights” podcast episode.

title: ‘Last Week Tonight with John Oliver’ no longer hitting YouTube the day after airing
description: HBO is delaying the upload of clips of "Last Week Tonight with John Oliver" to YouTube in hopes of encouraging viewers to sign up for subscriptions to its streaming platform.

title: First federal gender-based hate crime trial starts in South Carolina over trans woman’s killing
description: The first federal trial over a hate crime based on gender identity is set to begin in South Carolina, where a man faces charges that he killed a Black transgender woman and then fled to New York.

title: Man who fatally shot 2 Minnesota officers and a first responder died by suicide, medical examiner says
description: The man who fatally shot two Minnesota police officers and a first responder over the weekend while barricaded inside a home died by suicide, the Hennepin County Medical Examiner said.

title: Supreme Court declines to weigh whether jurors can be excluded for religious beliefs
description: The Supreme Court declined to consider whether potential jurors in an employment dispute involving a lesbian worker could be excluded because of their religious views on homosexuality.

title: Police called to investigate alleged LGBTQ propaganda at Russian 'My Little Pony' convention
description: Police in Moscow were called to investigate alleged LGBTQ propaganda at a fan event dedicated to the cartoon series “My Little Pony,” organizers said.

title: Sam Mendes to direct four separate Beatles movies on Paul, John, George and Ringo
description: John, Paul, George and Ringo will each be the subject of a different feature film.

title: Supreme Court allows sanctions against Trump-allied lawyers over 2020 election lawsuit
description: The Supreme Court rejected appeals brought by Trump-allied lawyers who faced legal sanctions for baselessly alleging in court that the 2020 election in Michigan was fraudulently won by President Joe Biden.

title: Alexei Navalny's mom demands Putin hand over his body; widow's account is briefly suspended by X
description: The account of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny's widow Yulia Navalnaya was suspended Tuesday by X, the social media platform formerly known as Twitter.

title: Supreme Court stays out of racial preferences fight over Virginia high school's admissions
description: The Supreme Court avoided another contentious debate over race and education by turning away a challenge to an admissions policy aimed at encouraging diversity at a Virginia high school.

title: Video of man wearing Apple Vision Pro prompts reminder from police to 'cross streets the old-fashioned way'
description: The Apple Vision Pro augmented reality headset has become one of the most talked-about gadgets around, but police are warning users to continue to cross the street the old-fashioned way.

title: House leaders launch bipartisan artificial intelligence task force
description: Speaker Mike Johnson and Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries are launching a bipartisan task force on artificial intelligence to explore how Congress can help America be a leader in AI innovation.

title: Are you still smarter than an AI? There’s a way to keep track
description: What’s the most powerful artificial intelligence model at any given moment?

title: New MLB jerseys drawing mixed reviews among players and fans
description: The reviews are in and the new MLB jerseys are — well, mixed.

title: Putin gave Kim Jong Un a luxury car as a gift
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has received a car from Russia’s President Vladimir Putin “for his personal use,” North Korean state media reported Tuesday, a possible violation of a U.N. resolution against Pyongyang that Russia also agreed to.

title: Colorado student arrested for murder and Trump compares legal woes to Alexei Navalny's death: Morning Rundown
description: Trump compares legal woes to Navalny's death. U.S. pushes a temporary Gaza cease-fire at U.N. Ruby Franke to be sentenced. Cougar attack near Seattle.

title: Ruby Franke to be sentenced in child abuse case
description: Former family vlogger Ruby Franke is expected to be sentenced Tuesday in a monthslong child abuse case brought against the Utah mother of six.

title: Prominent election deniers are running again in 2024, but some have toned down their claims
description: Republican candidates who falsely claimed Donald Trump beat Joe Biden in the 2020 election are running for office again after losing in the 2022 midterms.

title: Two years after Russian invasion, landmines plague one-third of Ukraine
description: Mines, including a deadly new Russian version, litter a swathe of Ukraine roughly the size of Florida, undermining an international effort to ban the weapons.

title: U.S. pushes for temporary Gaza cease-fire at U.N. vote
description: The U.S. has vowed to veto a resolution calling for a full cease-fire which was introduced by Algeria.

title: D.C. United fan groups plan protest of the MLS club’s preseason trip to Saudi Arabia
description: WASHINGTON — Five D.C.

title: Human leg found abandoned on New York Subway track
description: A human leg has been found abandoned on a New York subway track, police said, sparking an investigation into who it once belonged to and how they lost it.

title: Surgeries canceled as South Korean doctors walk out to protest government policy
description: Trainee doctors in South Korea collectively walked off their jobs Tuesday to protest a push to increase the number of medical students.

title: Biden campaign and allied Democratic groups raised $42 million in January
description: President Joe Biden and Democratic groups raised $42 million in January as they prepare for a likely rematch with Donald Trump in the 2024 election.

title: This year will see more elections than ever. But don’t call it a win for democracy.
description: This year will see more elections than any other on record, from the United States to India and South Africa to El Salvador. And yet democracy is in decline.

title: Indian farmers reject government offer, vowing to continue march to New Delhi
description: Indian farmers demanding guaranteed crop prices have rejected a proposal from the government, saying they will continue their march to the capital, New Delhi.

title: WikiLeaks founder Assange starts final U.K. legal battle to avoid extradition to U.S. on spy charges
description: Julian Assange’s lawyers will begin their final U.K. legal challenge on Tuesday to stop the WikiLeaks founder from being sent to the United States to face spying charges.

title: Lionel Messi says he had no ‘political reasons’ for missing Hong Kong match
description: Soccer star Lionel Messi said his failure to play in an exhibition game in Hong Kong this month had nothing to do with “political reasons.”

title: Russia detains Los Angeles woman on suspicion of treason
description: Russian authorities have detained a woman who is a Los Angeles resident and dual national on suspicion of treason for raising funds to support Ukraine in its defense against the Kremlin's invasion.

title: Chinese coast guard boards Taiwan tourist boat as it steps up patrols
description: China’s coast guard briefly boarded a Taiwanese tourist boat, a Taiwan minister said Tuesday, escalating a dispute over the deaths of two Chinese fishermen.

title: Taliban refuses to join U.N.-sponsored meeting on Afghanistan
description: A United Nations-sponsored conference on Afghanistan aimed at improving dialogue with the country’s Taliban rulers has ended after they failed to show up.

title: Cyclists fight off cougar in rare attack east of Seattle that leaves woman injured
description: A group of cyclists east of Seattle fended off cougar in a rare attack over the weekend that left a woman with injuries to her neck and face, authorities said.

title: Astronomers find what may be the universe’s brightest object with a black hole devouring a sun a day
description: Astronomers have discovered what may be the brightest object in the universe, a quasar with a black hole at its heart growing so fast that it swallows the equivalent of a sun a day.

title: Investigators are looking at the gearbox in deadly U.S. Air Force Osprey crash
description: The investigation into yet another deadly crash of a U.S. military Osprey aircraft in late November is looking at a possible mishap involving the aircraft’s propeller rotor gear box, U.S. officials say.

title: Capital One to acquire Discover Financial Services in $35.3 billion all-stock deal
description: Capital One Financial is set to acquire Discover Financial Services in a $35.3 billion all-stock deal.

title: Suspect who fatally shot 2 officers, 1 first responder was not permitted to own firearm
description: The man who fatally shot two Minnesota police officers and a first responder over the weekend was prohibited from owning a firearm and made an unsuccessful bid to overturn the lifelong state ban four years ago, court records show.

title: Widow of Haiti’s president, ex-prime minister and former police chief indicted in assassination
description: A judge investigating the July 2021 assassination of President Jovenel Moïse issued a final report on Monday that indicts his widow, Martine Moïse, ex-prime minister Claude Joseph and the former chief of Haiti’s National Police, Léon Charles, among others.

title: Powerful storms pummel California, creating dangerous conditions for travelers
description: About 35 million people are under flood watches in California, as another round of storms sweeps across the region. The rain is creating dangerous conditions for travelers, particularly in Santa Barbara County. NBC News' Liz Kreutz has more.
